questions.question_text: When installing Enterprise Security, what should be done after installing the add-ons necessary for normalizing data?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
last step regarding add-ons :

Set up a Splunk data input and confirm the source type settings: The README file of the add-on includes information about the source type setting associated with the data, and might include customization notes about configuring the input.

choices.D: Configure the add-ons according to their README or documentation.
choices.C: Disable the add-ons until they are ready to be used, then enable the add-ons.
choices.A: Nothing, there are no additional steps for add-ons.
choices.B: Configure the add-ons via the Content Management dashboard.

choices.C: Any content type listed in the Content Management page.
choices.D: Only correlation searches, glass tables, and workbench panels.
choices.A: Only correlation searches, managed lookups, and glass tables.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
You can export any of the content types on the Content Management page by selecting them in the custom search list and choosing Export (ES Admin 6.6 p 236)
See slide 231 "Content Import/Export" on Administering Splunk Enterprise Security 7.X

questions.question_text: What can be exported from ES using the Content Management page?

choices.C: On a server with a new install of Splunk.
choices.A: On a Splunk server with top level visibility.
choices.D: On a Splunk server running Splunk DB Connect.

discussion.content: B. you can ES is a App that can be install on any server

Selected Answer: C
C. On a server with a new install of Splunk.

Selected Answer: C
I believe it is C - Splunk Enterprise Security Admin slides 113

questions.question_text: Where should an ES search head be installed?

choices.D: From Splunk Access Controls, select the ess_user role and remove the edit_notable_events capability.
choices.A: In Enterprise Security, give the ess_user role the Own Notable Events permission.
choices.C: From the Status Configuration window select the Resolved status. Remove ess_user from the status transitions for the Closed status.
choices.B: From the Status Configuration window select the Closed status. Remove ess_user from the status transitions for the Resolved status.

discussion.content: Configure >>> Incident Management >>> Status Configuration >>> Resolved.....

Selected Answer: C
Page 38. In Status Configuration, you select the "Resolved" then remove the user from the transition "Closed"

questions.question_text:
Following the installation of ES, an admin configured users with the ess_user role the ability to close notable events.
How would the admin restrict these users from being able to change the status of Resolved notable events to Closed?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer: A

system and hardware requirements, and the search head and indexer. 
Deployment planning
Deploy Splunk Enterprise Security on a configured Splunk platform installation. Review the system and hardware requirements and the search head and indexer considerations before deploying Enterprise Security.

https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/ES/7.0.2/Install/DeploymentPlanning

Selected Answer: A
P: 322, adding ES might require additional indexers, since additional searches will be required, additional indexes will be need to support these new searches.
